# Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure

## Overview
Set up the foundational project structure, Docker infrastructure, database models, migrations, and configuration. This is the prerequisite for all other Phase 1 features - it establishes the backend/frontend project skeletons, Docker Compose services, PostgreSQL schema, OpenSearch client, Redis/Celery config, and health check endpoint.

## User Stories Covered
None directly - this is foundational infrastructure that enables V1, V2, V3, P1, P2, P3, S1, S3, M1.

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `docker-compose.yml` - All services (postgres, opensearch, redis, backend, celery-worker, frontend)
- `docker-compose.dev.yml` - Development overrides (hot reload, volume mounts)
- `.env.example` - Environment variable template
- `backend/Dockerfile` - Python 3.11 + FFmpeg + system deps
- `backend/requirements.txt` - Phase 1 Python dependencies (pinned versions)
- `backend/alembic.ini` - Alembic configuration
- `backend/app/__init__.py` - Package init
- `backend/app/main.py` - FastAPI application entry with CORS, router mounting, health endpoint
- `backend/app/core/__init__.py` - Core package init
- `backend/app/core/config.py` - Settings via pydantic-settings (DATABASE_URL, OPENSEARCH_URL, REDIS_URL, etc.)
- `backend/app/core/database.py` - SQLAlchemy async engine, session factory, Base model
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - OpenSearch client singleton
- `backend/app/models/__init__.py` - Models package init
- `backend/app/models/video.py` - Video SQLAlchemy model (id, title, file_path, processed_path, thumbnail_path, duration, recording_date, participants[], context_notes, status, error_message, created_at, updated_at)
- `backend/app/models/transcript.py` - Transcript model (id, video_id FK, full_text, language, word_count, created_at)
- `backend/app/models/segment.py` - Segment model (id, transcript_id FK, video_id FK, start_time, end_time, text, speaker, chunking_method, embedding_indexed, created_at)
- `backend/app/migrations/versions/001_initial.py` - Initial Alembic migration creating videos, transcripts, segments tables
- `backend/app/schemas/__init__.py` - Schemas package init
- `backend/app/api/__init__.py` - API package init
- `backend/app/api/deps.py` - Dependency injection (get_db session)
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Routes package init
- `backend/app/tasks/__init__.py` - Tasks package init
- `backend/app/tasks/celery_app.py` - Celery configuration with Redis broker
- `backend/app/services/__init__.py` - Services package init
- `frontend/Dockerfile` - Node.js 20 + Vite build + Nginx serve
- `frontend/package.json` - Phase 1 dependencies (react, react-dom, react-router-dom, axios, video.js, typescript, vite, tailwindcss, vitest)
- `frontend/vite.config.ts` - Vite config with React plugin, proxy to backend
- `frontend/tailwind.config.js` - Tailwind configuration
- `frontend/tsconfig.json` - TypeScript config
- `frontend/src/main.tsx` - React entry point
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Router setup with routes for /, /upload, /videos/:id, /search
- `frontend/src/api/client.ts` - Axios instance with base URL config
- `frontend/src/styles/index.css` - Tailwind imports
- `frontend/src/types/video.ts` - Video, Transcript, Segment TypeScript types
- `frontend/src/types/search.ts` - Search request/response types
- `frontend/index.html` - HTML entry point
- `data/videos/original/.gitkeep` - Directory structure
- `data/videos/processed/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/audio/.gitkeep`
- `data/videos/thumbnails/.gitkeep`
- `data/transcripts/.gitkeep`

### Dependencies
- Docker and Docker Compose installed on host
- Python 3.11, Node.js 20.x LTS
- See docs/design/technology-stack.md for all pinned versions

### Key Design Decisions
- PostgreSQL 16.1 as source of truth; OpenSearch 2.11.1 as derived search index
- Redis 7.2.4 as Celery broker
- FastAPI with pydantic-settings for config
- SQLAlchemy 2.0 with async support
- Alembic for migrations
- Vite + React 18 + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS for frontend
- Video.js 8.6 for HTML5 player (Phase 5 - P1 feature)
- All services run in Docker containers; dev overrides mount source for hot reload

## Implementation Notes
- Use the exact versions from docs/design/technology-stack.md
- Backend Dockerfile needs FFmpeg installed (apt-get install ffmpeg)
- OpenSearch must have security plugin disabled for dev (DISABLE_SECURITY_PLUGIN=true)
- Database URL format: postgresql://whedifaqaui:password@postgres:5432/whedifaqaui
- Health endpoint should check postgres and opensearch connectivity
- Celery worker uses same Docker image as backend, different CMD
- Frontend Dockerfile: multi-stage build (node for build, nginx for serve)
- GPU support in docker-compose for CUDA-accelerated transcription (optional for dev)
- Status enum values: uploaded, processing, transcribing, chunking, indexing, ready, error

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: All sections (this feature provides infrastructure for all tests)

### Unit Tests
- V3-U01: test_status_enum_values - verify all status values are defined

### Integration Tests
- Health endpoint returns 200 with status ok
- Database connection works
- OpenSearch client connects

### E2E Scenarios
- No E2E scenarios directly - this feature enables all subsequent E2E tests

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- docker compose up -d starts all services without errors
- curl localhost:8000/api/health returns {"status":"ok"}
- curl localhost:9200/_cluster/health returns cluster status
- Alembic migration creates all 3 tables (videos, transcripts, segments)
- Frontend dev server starts at localhost:3000
- React app renders with router (shows placeholder pages)

## Reference Documentation
- docs/design/technology-stack.md - All pinned versions and package lists
- docs/design/data-model.md - PostgreSQL schema and OpenSearch index definitions
- docs/design/deployment.md - Docker Compose configuration
- docs/implementation/phase1.md - Project structure and component specs

description:
## Objective
Verify the complete Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure feature works end-to-end: all Docker services start, health endpoint responds, database migration applies, and frontend serves.

- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Section: V3 (Processing Status)

```bash
docker compose exec backend pytest tests/unit/test_video.py -v
```
Expected: V3-U01 (test_status_enum_values) passes

### Infrastructure Verification
```bash
# 1. All services healthy
docker compose ps

# 2. Backend health check
curl -s http://localhost:8000/api/health | python3 -c "import sys,json; d=json.load(sys.stdin); assert d['status']=='ok', f'Health check failed: {d}'"

# 3. OpenSearch accessible
curl -s http://localhost:9200/_cluster/health | python3 -c "import sys,json; d=json.load(sys.stdin); print(f'OpenSearch: {d[\"status\"]}')"

# 4. Database tables exist
docker compose exec backend python -c "
from app.core.database import engine
from sqlalchemy import inspect
insp = inspect(engine)
tables = sorted(insp.get_table_names())
print('Tables:', tables)
assert 'videos' in tables, 'videos table missing'
assert 'transcripts' in tables, 'transcripts table missing'
assert 'segments' in tables, 'segments table missing'
print('All tables verified')
"

# 5. Frontend serves HTML
curl -s http://localhost:3000 | grep -q 'root' && echo 'Frontend OK'
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] docker compose up -d starts all services without errors
- [ ] curl localhost:8000/api/health returns {"status":"ok"}
- [ ] curl localhost:9200/_cluster/health returns cluster status
- [ ] Alembic migration creates all 3 tables (videos, transcripts, segments)
- [ ] Frontend serves at localhost:3000
- [ ] V3-U01 unit test passes
- [ ] No regressions in existing tests

## Verification

### Verification Loop
The agent must:
1. Start all services: docker compose up -d
2. Wait for services to be healthy
3. Run each verification command above
4. Run unit tests
5. If any check fails: investigate and fix
6. Only mark complete when ALL checks pass

# Feature: Video Playback & Transcript UI

## Overview
Implement the video playback page with an embedded HTML5 player, synchronized transcript panel, and timestamp navigation. Users can watch processed videos, see the transcript highlighted in sync with playback, click transcript segments to seek the video, and share deep links to specific timestamps via URL parameters.

## User Stories Covered
- P1: Embedded video player with standard controls
- P2: Timestamp navigation (clickable timestamps, URL deep-linking)
- P3: Synchronized transcript display (current segment highlighted, click to seek)

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/api/routes/playback.py` - GET /videos/{id}/stream (video file serving with Range request support), GET /videos/{id}/transcript (transcript segments with timestamps and speakers)
- `backend/app/schemas/transcript.py` - TranscriptResponse, SegmentResponse Pydantic schemas
- `frontend/src/pages/VideoPage.tsx` - Video playback page: player + transcript panel side-by-side, URL timestamp parameter handling (?t=seconds)
- `frontend/src/components/video/VideoPlayer.tsx` - HTML5 video player using Video.js with standard controls (play, pause, seek, volume), src pointing to /videos/{id}/stream
- `frontend/src/components/video/TranscriptPanel.tsx` - Scrollable transcript with segments, current segment highlighted, click to seek, speaker labels, auto-scroll during playback
- `frontend/src/components/video/TimestampLink.tsx` - Clickable timestamp component (formats seconds to MM:SS, onClick seeks player)
- `frontend/src/hooks/useVideoPlayer.ts` - Custom hook for player state management (currentTime, playing, seek function)
- `frontend/src/hooks/useTranscriptSync.ts` - Custom hook for transcript synchronization (determines active segment based on currentTime)
- `frontend/src/types/transcript.ts` - Transcript and Segment TypeScript types
- `backend/tests/integration/test_playback_api.py` - Playback API tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Mount playback router
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export playback router
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Import and use VideoPage component
- `frontend/src/api/videos.ts` - Add getTranscript() API function

### Dependencies
- Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure (w-6nz) must be complete
- Feature: Video Upload & Storage (w-a4r) must be complete (video records exist)
- Feature: Video Processing Pipeline (w-csa) must be complete (MP4 transcoded, transcript generated)
- Video.js 8.6.x for the player component

### Key Design Decisions
- Video served as MP4 from /data/videos/processed/{id}.mp4 via streaming endpoint
- Range request support (HTTP 206) for seek functionality
- Transcript endpoint returns array of segments with: id, start_time, end_time, text, speaker
- Timestamp format: seconds displayed as MM:SS (e.g., 125s → "2:05")
- URL deep-linking: /videos/{id}?t=125 auto-seeks to 2:05 on page load
- Transcript auto-scrolls to keep active segment visible during playback
- Active segment determined by: segment.start_time <= currentTime < segment.end_time
- Video.js player wrapped in React component with ref for programmatic control

## Implementation Notes
- Stream endpoint: use FileResponse or StreamingResponse with media_type="video/mp4"
- Support Range headers for partial content (HTTP 206) - critical for seek
- Transcript endpoint queries segments table ordered by start_time
- VideoPlayer component: initialize Video.js on mount, destroy on unmount
- TranscriptPanel: listen to player timeupdate events, find active segment, apply 'active' CSS class
- TimestampLink: format seconds with Math.floor(s/60) + ":" + pad(s%60)
- URL timestamp: read ?t= from useSearchParams, seek player on mount
- When user clicks transcript segment, call player.currentTime(segment.start_time)
- Speaker labels displayed as "SPEAKER_00:" prefix on each segment
- Use data-testid attributes for Playwright testing (see test spec for exact IDs)

## Testing Requirements

# Feature: Video Processing Pipeline

## Overview
Implement the async processing pipeline that transforms uploaded MKV videos into searchable, playable content. This includes FFmpeg transcoding (MKV→MP4), audio extraction, thumbnail generation, WhisperX transcription with speaker diarization, semantic chunking with embeddings, and status updates throughout. The pipeline runs as a chain of Celery tasks.

## User Stories Covered
- V2: Automatic transcription with timestamps and speaker diarization
- V3: Processing status indicators (pipeline-side: status transitions during processing)
- C1: Semantic chunking (transcript segmented into semantic chunks for indexing)
- P1: Embedded video player (prerequisite: MP4 transcoding)

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/services/ffmpeg.py` - FFmpeg operations: remux/transcode MKV→MP4, extract audio WAV, generate thumbnail
- `backend/app/services/transcription.py` - WhisperX integration: model loading, transcription + speaker diarization, output parsing
- `backend/app/services/chunking.py` - Semantic chunking: embedding-based boundary detection, chunk creation with speaker labels
- `backend/app/services/embedding.py` - BGE model wrapper (BAAI/bge-base-en-v1.5): batch embedding generation, 768-dim vectors
- `backend/app/tasks/video_processing.py` - Celery task: FFmpeg remux/transcode, thumbnail, audio extraction; updates status to 'processing'
- `backend/app/tasks/transcription.py` - Celery task: WhisperX transcription + diarization → JSON output, creates transcript + initial segments in DB; updates status to 'transcribing'
- `backend/app/tasks/chunking.py` - Celery task: semantic chunking → segments in DB with speaker labels; updates status to 'chunking'
- `backend/app/tasks/indexing.py` - Celery task: generate embeddings, bulk index segments to OpenSearch; updates status to 'indexing' then 'ready'
- `backend/tests/unit/test_transcription.py` - WhisperX output parsing tests
- `backend/tests/unit/test_chunking.py` - Semantic chunking logic tests
- `backend/tests/unit/test_embedding.py` - Embedding generation tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_processing_pipeline.py` - Full pipeline integration tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/tasks/celery_app.py` - Register all task modules
- `backend/app/services/video.py` - Add status update methods
- `backend/app/api/routes/videos.py` - Ensure upload endpoint dispatches the processing chain

### Dependencies
- Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure (w-6nz) must be complete
- Feature: Video Upload & Storage (w-a4r) must be complete (upload creates DB record)
- FFmpeg installed in Docker container
- WhisperX + pyannote.audio for transcription/diarization
- sentence-transformers for BGE embeddings
- HuggingFace token for pyannote models (env var)
- CUDA optional but recommended for performance

### Key Design Decisions
- Pipeline stages chained as Celery tasks: video_processing → transcription → chunking → indexing
- Each stage updates video status in PostgreSQL (processing → transcribing → chunking → indexing → ready)
- On any error, status set to 'error' with error_message populated
- WhisperX provides both transcription AND speaker labels (SPEAKER_00, SPEAKER_01, etc.)
- Transcript JSON saved to /data/transcripts/{video_id}.json for LLM verification
- Semantic chunking uses embedding cosine similarity to detect topic boundaries
- Chunking parameters from system_settings: similarity_threshold=0.5, min_chunk_tokens=100, max_chunk_tokens=500
- BGE model: BAAI/bge-base-en-v1.5, 768-dimensional embeddings
- OpenSearch indexing: bulk API with segment text, embedding, metadata

## Implementation Notes
- FFmpeg remux: if source is MKV with H.264+AAC, remux to MP4 (fast copy). Otherwise, transcode.
- Audio extraction: ffmpeg -i input.mp4 -vn -acodec pcm_s16le -ar 16000 -ac 1 output.wav
- Thumbnail: extract frame at 10% of duration, resize to 320x180
- WhisperX workflow: load model → transcribe → align → diarize → merge segments
- Speaker labels format: "SPEAKER_00", "SPEAKER_01", etc. from pyannote
- Transcript saved as JSON with segments[{start, end, text, speaker}]
- Semantic chunking algorithm:
  1. Compute sentence-level embeddings
  2. Calculate cosine similarity between consecutive sentences
  3. Split at points where similarity drops below threshold
  4. Merge small chunks, split large chunks
  5. Preserve speaker attribution per chunk
- OpenSearch document format: {id, video_id, video_title, transcript_id, text, embedding, start_time, end_time, speaker, recording_date, created_at}
- Error handling: wrap each stage in try/except, set video status='error' with descriptive message
- Temporary audio files cleaned up after transcription

- C1-U02: test_chunk_preserves_speaker - Speaker label retained per chunk
- C1-U03: test_chunk_timestamps_valid - start_time < end_time for each chunk
- C1-U04: test_semantic_boundary_detection - Splits at natural topic breaks
- P1-U01: test_video_transcode_to_mp4 - FFmpeg produces valid MP4
- P1-U02: test_processed_path_stored - processed_path updated in DB

### Integration Tests
- V2-I01: test_transcription_creates_transcript_record - Transcript row created with correct video_id
- V2-I02: test_transcription_creates_segments - Segment count matches WhisperX output
- V2-I03: test_audio_extraction - WAV extracted from MKV successfully

# Feature: Video Processing Pipeline

## Overview
Implement the async Celery pipeline that processes uploaded videos through four stages: FFmpeg transcode (MKV→MP4 + audio extraction + thumbnail), WhisperX transcription with speaker diarization, semantic chunking with embeddings, and status tracking through each stage. This is the core backend intelligence that transforms raw video into searchable content.

## User Stories Covered
- V2: Automatic transcription with timestamps and speaker diarization
- V3: Processing status indicators (status transitions through pipeline)
- C1: Semantic chunking for search indexing
- P1 (partial): FFmpeg transcode to MP4 for browser playback

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/services/ffmpeg.py` - FFmpeg operations: remux_to_mp4(input, output), extract_audio(input, output_wav), generate_thumbnail(input, output, timestamp=5)
- `backend/app/services/transcription.py` - WhisperX integration: load_model(), transcribe(audio_path) → {segments with speaker labels, language, word_count}
- `backend/app/services/chunking.py` - Semantic chunking: chunk_transcript(segments) → chunks with start/end times, text, speaker, using embedding similarity for boundary detection
- `backend/app/services/embedding.py` - BGE model wrapper: load_model(), generate_embedding(text) → 768-dim vector, batch_embed(texts) → list of vectors
- `backend/app/tasks/video_processing.py` - Celery task: remux/transcode MKV→MP4, extract audio WAV, generate thumbnail, update status to "processing"→"transcribing"
- `backend/app/tasks/transcription.py` - Celery task: run WhisperX on audio, save transcript record, save WhisperX JSON to /data/transcripts/{video_id}.json, create segments in DB, update status to "transcribing"→"chunking"
- `backend/app/tasks/chunking.py` - Celery task: read raw segments, apply semantic chunking, generate embeddings, save chunked segments to DB, update status to "chunking"→"indexing"
- `backend/app/tasks/indexing.py` - Celery task: read segments from DB, bulk index to OpenSearch with embeddings, update status to "indexing"→"ready"
- `backend/tests/unit/test_transcription.py` - WhisperX output parsing tests
- `backend/tests/unit/test_chunking.py` - Semantic chunking logic tests
- `backend/tests/unit/test_embedding.py` - Embedding generation tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_processing_pipeline.py` - Full pipeline integration tests
- `scripts/prepare-test-data.sh` - Test data preparation script (download YouTube video, create test files)
- `scripts/convert_srt_to_ground_truth.py` - SRT to ground truth JSON converter

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/tasks/celery_app.py` - Register task modules
- `backend/app/models/video.py` - May need status transition helper method
- `backend/app/core/config.py` - Add WHISPER_MODEL, WHISPER_DEVICE, HF_TOKEN settings

### Dependencies
- Feature 1 (Scaffolding): Models, DB, Celery config
- Feature 2 (Upload): Video records exist in DB, upload triggers pipeline
- External: FFmpeg (system package), WhisperX (pip), pyannote.audio (pip + HuggingFace token), sentence-transformers (pip)

### Key Design Decisions
- Pipeline is a Celery chain: video_processing → transcription → chunking → indexing
- Each task updates video status before starting its work
- Error handling: if any task fails, set status to "error" with error_message
- WhisperX provides both transcription AND speaker diarization (SPEAKER_00, SPEAKER_01, etc.)
- Semantic chunking uses embedding cosine similarity to detect topic boundaries (not fixed size)
- Chunk size target: 50-500 words
- Chunks split at sentence boundaries
- Each chunk preserves speaker attribution
- Embeddings use BGE model (BAAI/bge-base-en-v1.5) producing 768-dim vectors
- Audio extracted as WAV temporarily, deleted after transcription
- WhisperX JSON output saved to /data/transcripts/{video_id}.json for LLM verification
- Thumbnail generated at 5-second mark of video

## Implementation Notes
- Use ffmpeg-python library for FFmpeg operations
- WhisperX API: whisperx.load_model(model, device), model.transcribe(audio), whisperx.load_align_model(), whisperx.align(), whisperx.DiarizationPipeline(), diarize_model(audio)
- Semantic chunking algorithm: compute embeddings for each raw segment, calculate cosine similarity between consecutive segments, split where similarity drops below threshold
- Tasks should be idempotent where possible (re-runnable on failure)
- Status transitions must be atomic (use DB transaction)
- Processing status flow: uploaded → processing → transcribing → chunking → indexing → ready
- On error: status → error, error_message populated with descriptive text (not stack trace)
- Celery task chaining: video_processing.s(video_id) | transcription.s() | chunking.s() | indexing.s()
- For testing: mock WhisperX with deterministic output, test actual FFmpeg with small test video

## Testing Requirements

### Unit Tests

- V2-U03: test_speaker_label_extraction - "SPEAKER_00" format preserved

- C1-U03: test_chunk_timestamps_valid - start_time < end_time

### Integration Tests

# Feature: Search & Indexing

## Overview
Implement the hybrid search system that enables natural language queries across all indexed video transcripts. This includes the OpenSearch index setup, hybrid query construction (BM25 keyword + kNN vector similarity), search API endpoint, and search result ranking. Users can search with free-text queries and get results with video references, timestamps, and text snippets.

## User Stories Covered
- S1: Natural language search (hybrid: BM25 + vector)
- S3: Search results link directly to video timestamps (backend: results include video_id, start_time)

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/services/search.py` - OpenSearch hybrid query builder: BM25 text search + kNN vector search, Reciprocal Rank Fusion for combining scores, result formatting
- `backend/app/schemas/search.py` - SearchRequest (query string, optional filters), SearchResponse (results with video_id, video_title, text, start_time, end_time, speaker, score)
- `backend/app/api/routes/search.py` - GET /search?q=... endpoint with query parameter, returns ranked search results
- `backend/tests/unit/test_search.py` - Query construction and result ranking tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_search_api.py` - Search API integration tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Mount search router
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export search router
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - Add index creation/management methods, ensure segments_index exists with correct mapping

### Dependencies
- Feature: Project Scaffolding & Infrastructure (w-6nz) must be complete
- Feature: Video Processing Pipeline (w-csa) must be complete (provides indexed segments)
- OpenSearch 2.11.1 with kNN plugin enabled
- sentence-transformers for query embedding generation (reuses embedding service)

### Key Design Decisions
- Hybrid search: combine BM25 (keyword) and kNN (semantic) results using Reciprocal Rank Fusion (RRF)
- Query embedding uses same BGE model (BAAI/bge-base-en-v1.5) as indexing
- Default results: top 10 segments, sorted by combined RRF score
- Search results include: video_id, video_title, text snippet, start_time, end_time, speaker, relevance score
- OpenSearch segments_index uses English analyzer for text field, HNSW for kNN vectors
- Empty query returns error or empty results (not all documents)

## Implementation Notes
- OpenSearch hybrid query structure:
  ```json
  {
    "query": {
      "bool": {
        "should": [
          {"match": {"text": {"query": "user query", "boost": 1.0}}},
          {"knn": {"embedding": {"vector": [query_embedding], "k": 10}}}
        ]
      }
    }
  }
  ```
- Generate query embedding at search time using the embedding service
- RRF formula: score = sum(1 / (k + rank_i)) where k=60 (standard constant)
- Search results include video_title joined from the indexed document
- Handle edge cases: empty query, no results, OpenSearch connection errors
- Index mapping must have knn=true in settings
- Segment fields indexed: id, video_id, video_title, transcript_id, text, embedding (768-dim), start_time, end_time, speaker, recording_date, created_at

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: S1 (Natural Language Search), S3 (Timestamp Links in Results)

### Unit Tests
- S1-U01: test_embedding_generation - BGE model generates 768-dim vector
- S1-U02: test_hybrid_query_construction - Both BM25 and kNN clauses present in query
- S1-U03: test_search_result_ranking - Results sorted by score descending
- S1-U04: test_empty_query_handled - Empty string returns empty or error

### Integration Tests
- S1-I01: test_search_finds_keyword_match - Query with known keyword returns matching segment
- S1-I02: test_search_finds_semantic_match - Conceptual query returns semantically relevant segment
- S1-I03: test_search_no_results - Query "nonexistent xyz" returns empty results
- S1-I04: test_search_across_videos - Multi-video search returns results from multiple videos
- S1-I05: test_opensearch_index_mapping - Index has kNN enabled, 768-dim vector field, english analyzer
- S3-I01: test_search_results_include_timestamps - start_time float value present in results
- S3-I02: test_search_results_include_video_id - video_id UUID present in results

### E2E Scenarios

- E2E-04: Search with no results - "nonexistent term xyz123" shows no results message

### Quality Gate

- All S1 unit tests pass (S1-U01 through S1-U04)
- All S1 integration tests pass (S1-I01 through S1-I05)
- All S3 integration tests pass (S3-I01, S3-I02)

# Feature: Search & Indexing

## Overview
Implement the OpenSearch indexing and hybrid search (BM25 + vector/kNN) backend. This includes creating the OpenSearch index with proper mappings, the indexing service that bulk-indexes segments with embeddings, and the search API that accepts natural language queries, generates query embeddings, constructs hybrid queries, and returns ranked results with video IDs and timestamps.

## User Stories Covered
- S1: Natural language search (hybrid: BM25 + vector)
- S3 (backend): Search results include video_id and timestamps

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/services/search.py` - Search service: create_index(), index_segments(segments), hybrid_search(query, limit) → ranked results with video_id, start_time, end_time, text, speaker, score
- `backend/app/api/routes/search.py` - GET /api/search?q=...&limit=10 → search results
- `backend/app/schemas/search.py` - SearchQuery, SearchResult, SearchResponse Pydantic schemas
- `backend/tests/unit/test_search.py` - Search query construction, result ranking tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_search_api.py` - Search API integration tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Register search routes
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export search router
- `backend/app/core/opensearch.py` - May need index management helpers
- `backend/app/tasks/indexing.py` - Wire up to search service for bulk indexing

### Dependencies
- Feature 1 (Scaffolding): OpenSearch client, config
- Feature 3 (Pipeline): Embedding service, segments with embeddings exist in DB
- External: opensearch-py, sentence-transformers (for query embedding)

### Key Design Decisions
- OpenSearch index name: "segments" (or configurable via settings)
- Index mapping: text (english analyzer), embedding (knn_vector 768-dim, HNSW, cosine), video_id, video_title, transcript_id, start_time, end_time, speaker, recording_date, created_at
- KNN enabled on index: settings.index.knn = true
- Hybrid search combines BM25 text match + kNN vector similarity
- Query embedding generated at search time using same BGE model as indexing
- Results ranked by combined score (Reciprocal Rank Fusion or weighted combination)
- Empty query returns empty results (not error)
- Search results include: video_id, video_title, text, start_time, end_time, speaker, score
- Limit/offset pagination support

## Implementation Notes
- OpenSearch index creation should be idempotent (check if exists first)
- Use opensearch-py bulk API for indexing segments
- Hybrid query structure: use OpenSearch "bool" query with "should" clauses for BM25 + script_score for kNN
- Alternatively, use OpenSearch native hybrid search if available in 2.11
- Query embedding: use same embedding.generate_embedding() from embedding service
- BM25 query: match on "text" field with english analyzer
- kNN query: cosinesimil on "embedding" field
- Result deduplication: if same segment appears in both BM25 and kNN results, take highest score
- Add video_title to indexed document for display in search results
- For testing: create test index with known documents, verify query returns expected results

## Testing Requirements

### Test Specification Reference
- Document: docs/testing/phase1-test-specification.md
- Sections: S1: Natural Language Search, S3: Timestamp Links in Results, C1 (partial - indexing)

- S1-U02: test_hybrid_query_construction - BM25 + kNN query both present
- S1-U03: test_search_result_ranking - Results sorted by score (highest first)
- S1-U04: test_empty_query_handled - Empty string returns empty results

### Integration Tests
- S1-I01: test_search_finds_keyword_match - Query keyword returns matching segment
- S1-I02: test_search_finds_semantic_match - Semantic query returns relevant segment
- S1-I03: test_search_no_results - Nonsense query returns empty results
- S1-I04: test_search_across_videos - Results from multiple indexed videos
- S1-I05: test_opensearch_index_mapping - Index has correct schema (kNN enabled, 768-dim, english analyzer)
- S3-I01: test_search_results_include_timestamps - start_time float present in results
- S3-I02: test_search_results_include_video_id - video_id UUID present in results
- C1-I02: test_chunks_indexed_to_opensearch - OpenSearch doc count matches DB segment count

### E2E Scenarios
- E2E-01 (steps 7-9): Search for key term, verify result found
- E2E-04: Search with no results, verify empty handling

### Quality Gate
This feature is NOT complete until:
- All S1-U*, S1-I*, S3-I* tests pass
- Hybrid search returns relevant results for both keyword and semantic queries
- Index mapping correct with kNN enabled
- Empty/nonsense queries handled gracefully
- Search results include video_id, start_time, text, speaker

# Feature: Video Upload & Storage

## Overview
Implement the video upload flow end-to-end: backend API endpoint for receiving MKV files with metadata, file storage to disk, database record creation, Celery task dispatch, and the frontend upload form with progress indication. This is the entry point for all video content in the system.

## User Stories Covered
- V1: Upload MKV with metadata (title, date, participants, notes)
- V3 (partial): Initial status set to "uploaded", status endpoint

## Technical Context

### Files to Create
- `backend/app/api/routes/videos.py` - POST /api/videos (multipart upload), GET /api/videos/{id}, GET /api/videos/{id}/status
- `backend/app/services/video.py` - Video CRUD: create_video (save file, create DB record, queue task), get_video, get_video_status
- `frontend/src/pages/UploadPage.tsx` - Upload page with form and progress
- `frontend/src/components/upload/UploadForm.tsx` - Form fields: file input (.mkv only), title, date, participants (comma-separated), context notes
- `frontend/src/components/upload/UploadProgress.tsx` - Upload progress bar using axios onUploadProgress
- `frontend/src/api/videos.ts` - API client: uploadVideo(), getVideo(), getVideoStatus()
- `backend/tests/unit/test_video_schema.py` - Schema validation tests
- `backend/tests/integration/test_video_api.py` - Upload API integration tests
- `frontend/src/__tests__/components/UploadForm.test.tsx` - Frontend upload tests

### Files to Modify
- `backend/app/main.py` - Register video routes
- `backend/app/api/routes/__init__.py` - Export video router
- `frontend/src/App.tsx` - Wire up UploadPage route

### Dependencies
- Feature 1 (Project Scaffolding) must be complete - provides models, DB, config, Docker

### Key Design Decisions
- File upload via multipart/form-data (python-multipart)
- Files saved to /data/videos/original/{uuid}.mkv
- Participants parsed from comma-separated string to TEXT[] array
- Upload endpoint returns video ID immediately, processing is async
- File extension validation: only .mkv accepted (400 for others)
- Title and recording_date are required fields (422 for missing)
- After DB record creation, dispatch Celery task for processing (video_processing.delay(video_id))
- Status endpoint supports polling from frontend

## Implementation Notes
- Upload endpoint must handle large files (streaming to disk, not memory)
- Use UploadFile from FastAPI for file handling
- Save file with UUID-based filename to avoid conflicts: {video_id}.mkv
- Frontend UploadForm uses controlled inputs with React state
- Progress bar uses axios upload progress callback
- After successful upload, redirect to library or show success message
- Participants field: split on comma, trim whitespace, store as array
